meanings.definition: To surpass in taste or flavor.
meanings.sent1: The homemade pie outsavored the store-bought one.
meanings.sent2: Her cooking always outsavored everyone else's at the potluck.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream outsavored the cake, making it the favorite dessert.
meanings.sent4: The fresh strawberries outsavored the bland apples in the fruit salad.
meanings.sent5: The rich aroma of the coffee outsavored any other drink on the menu.

meanings.definition: To be more enjoyable or pleasing than something else.
meanings.sent1: The movie outsavored all the others we watched this weekend.
meanings.sent2: The vacation outsavored our usual weekend getaways.
meanings.sent3: The new game outsavored the old one, keeping us entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: The sunset outsavored the sunrise, painting the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of children outsavored any other sound in the park.
